website_summaries.verdict: The Sennheiser Momentum In-Ear delivers bright (sometimes too bright) highs, paired with a powerful low frequency response.
pros: Powerful audio performance with robust bass response and bright highs
cons: Can be too bright at times
Only comes with two pairs of eartips

customer_reviews.title: Terribly quality
customer_reviews.text: Before buying look at how many reviews there are noting the poor build quality. After about three months of use the rubber insert started falling off in my ear whenever I took them out. Fit was fine, a tad loose even, but when I take them out one or both stay in my ear. At this price point this should not be happening. Aside from that completely unacceptable flaw the sound quality is meh at best. Clarity is poor, too much bass for my tastes but most will be fine with it. Never used the mic.
customer_reviews.author: J. Foster

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed with because they also fall out very easily and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of more expensive earbuds so I did a lot of research before buying them. I am disappointed because the fit and comfort of these are poor. I can only find one alternate size that fits in my ears without falling out and when they are in they hurt immediately and are very uncomfortable. I have tried all sorts of angles and switching ears but none of them work to relieve discomfort. They also fall out very easily, so they won't serve one of the key reasons I purchased them to make phone calls while walking somewhere. The only positive is that the sound quality does live up to its hype.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality of materials
customer_reviews.text: I bought my headphones on January 6, 2015. They cost pretty the same about $70, maybe a bit more. Now I have to throw them away because wires got very soft and sticky. The reason is pretty obvious - poor quality of materials which is common case of cheap headsets. Really I don't think that $70 is cheap. In most articles it's said that the reason is DEHP (google it) which also harmful for health. If you are going to use them a lot outside the buildings you might face the same problem much earlier. BTW Cable within wires is too thin so I had to fix remote control couple times.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Another waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this headset and opened the box to try them out.One earpiece works. The other earpiece is dead, no sound coming through at all. The "adjustment" bit on this headset, a dot, a minus and a plus....it may as well not be there you can press it all day and it makes no change whatsoever. I've bought over a dozen listening devices over the past couple of months not one of them worked, and I mean they did not work at all first try out of the container which tells me, there is no such thing as a headset that is worth more than $1.00.
customer_reviews.author: weshophere

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is great and the buttons work like expected
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great and the buttons work like expected, but the build quality is just awful. I have had these less than one year and the protective rubber covering on the wire is failing. It has split open in 3 places to expose the wires. I have come to expect much higher quality from Sennheiser, but they really dropped the ball on this. I will be going with Klipsch or Bose to replace these.
customer_reviews.author: Combine

customer_reviews.title: Decent Buy
customer_reviews.text: These work well, sound good and are comfortable. I bought these to replace $30 sony ear buds that I've had for a couple years. The Sony ones have a better bass and have a little better fit than the these Sennheisers but those are the only differences I have noted for myself. That being said they are still good if you want to shovel out the extra $ for them. If not and you like a little more bass then I would recommend the Sony earbuds with extra bass for $30.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Jones

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones that I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on cheep headphones and get some that have high quality earbuds like these. Excellent sound quality both via the earbuds and the mic. Everyone I speak to using these say that they can hear me very well without a bunch of background noise. Music sounds excellent as well. Build quality is great and they feel sturdy. The case is well made and will keep them from getting tangled. If I had to pick something negative to say about them (and this is being picky at the highest nouveau) I would have liked to have a choice of colors. As far as I can tell you only have one color choice.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Butters

customer_reviews.title: started off great but very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Got these about 6 months ago and was really enjoying them. The sound quality wasn't the best but was better than I expected for ear buds in this price point. Today when I pulled the left side out of my ear the earbud broke off in my ear. The left side obviously no longer produces sound. I'm really disappointed, I wish i had purchased the protection plan to go along with them. now I'll be looking for better ear buds.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: While the sound quality is pretty comparable to my bose ear buds however the silicon ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these earbuds about a year ago. While the sound quality is pretty comparable to my bose ear buds however the silicon tips are not very comfortable. Do yourself a favor and purchase the memory foam tips, you'll thank me later. Now my biggest gripe about these ear buds is the carrying case they come in. I noticed about a month ago I have a slight tear in my cable by the connector. I noticed that where the cable was torn was in the same area where the cable wraps around the case to secure the connector. I really feel that this is a manufacture error so buyer beware. I've supplied two photos below that show the tear.
customer_reviews.author: David B Rathjen Jr

customer_reviews.title: Decent headphones, not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality sound, not outstanding or anything. I have a couple issues from an ergonomic perspective. I frequently wrap these up and put them in my bag. Because of this, the rubber ear buds frequently pop off, with very little effort. Also, the flat cable is terrible. It's very narrow, so the width-to-thickness ratio means it's not actually that flat. It twists easily, and when it gets twisted or bent, the shape deforms and it becomes even less flat. Also the plastic piece that pulls the two cables together does not fit well, because of the way the cable deforms and stops being flat.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Pro's They sound great and have a medium amount of base
customer_reviews.text: Pro's They sound great and have a medium amount of base. They have a strong build quality and do not have to stay in the case. Con's If you don't keep them in the case you will lose your left earbud not the right but always lose the left one. They also take a bit more to power so if used with a phone they are not very loud. If you buy this buy extra earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Durability/Design
customer_reviews.text: I've owned two sets of these headphones and both had the same problem with design: the silicon part of the ear buds pop off with little force (meaning you lose them and have to use the other sizes as replacements) and the wire at the base of headphone jack wears out very quickly. For the price I paid ($99), these problems are too much. The sound quality was great, but the durability/design was terrible. Not worth the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: spend more time playing with them then listening to music
customer_reviews.text: got these ear buds but i really wish i went with a better name. they are a pain in the ass to fit in my ear. only came with large and small ear pieces. i have to readjust them alot to get a decent sound. when i do they sound ok but for spending 80 dollars i expected alot better. they look and feel kind of cheap and dont fit well. i will use them buy i wish i got the bose ear phones for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite midfi earbuds that work for answering calls or FT.
customer_reviews.text: I love these! Great bass, mids and highs. Full and a touch warm but never boomy or muddy. Articulate and clear yet easy to listen and with the right tip, very comfy. Coming from Etymotic ER-4P's these aren't as crisp or detailed, but have a fuller bottom end and leaner detail in the lowest octaves. That said they are excellent and essentially 97% of the performance with a third of the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: mark lohnes

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Volume Control Buttons
customer_reviews.text: (The overall sound is amazing, but the quality of the product is meh) I had the previous version of these. Only difference I noticed is the volume control buttons. Sadly, mine are failing. I had this for less than a month and probably used them 3 times. The volume will get EXTREMELY loud by itself like I'm pressing the up button. I have to unplug it because when I turn the volume down (using the phone buttons) it will go back up. Even though the durability is not great, trying to get a refund through the warranty will result in user error and no refund (the last one I had. Hopefully this time I get one)
customer_reviews.author: rans

customer_reviews.title: Awesome replacement for SE 215's!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got these to replace my 4 year old Shure SE 215's, so suffice to say they have big shoes to fill!! Haven't had a lot of time to listen to these buds, but all the stuff I did test them for, they performed splendidly!! The sound signature is surprisingly similar to my SE 215's and that's probably the best compliment I can give to a $99 earphone. The bass on these is a little more tight and controlled in comparison and I actually prefer it like this Will update my review once I've had to test them out more, but so far these earphones are looking to be a great purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Akshay

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great ear buds. These have a very clear crisp sound with good presence across all ranges. Good but not overpowering bass. My complaints would be the could be a warmer, midrange is slightly underpowered and treble is a bit too much. I almost returned them due to the treble being painfully high but after about two weeks of use they opened up a bit more in the mid range. I bought these For $89 after purchasing the cx300. Definitely worth the $50 difference. For the overall quality sound and features (mic etc) i am happy to use my phones equalizer to tone the treble down in the 16k+ range. Having bought dozens of headphones that are awful I'll take that.
customer_reviews.author: T$

customer_reviews.title: Love the earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Love the earbuds. I also own a Momentum over ear headphones and they are both great. But i do have couple of problems, the cord makes a lot of noise when it hits your clothes like your listening to music and you hear the cord banging on your clothes everytime. Also i hate how easily the buds come off. i already lost one and i have no clue where i can buy the replacements. Anyways all in all great earbuds minus the cord noise
customer_reviews.author: TINELX3

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: They lasted one month when the cord began to fray and the left side stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: SAStoelt

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE BUILD QUALITY!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These were really good headphones until I took them out of my room when I went on vacation. DO NOT put these things in your pocket where the input can bend or get even slightly smashed! They will develop a short with the slightest amount of pressure. I can not believe how fragile these earbuds are. They sound great and have decent noise cancellation. But they WILL eventually short out on you. I would suggest doing a whole lot of research before buying earbuds at this price do to how deceiving most of the reviews and advertisements can be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Premium sound, with significant drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Kind of just echoing what everyone else is saying about it: Sound is great, but the wire is needlessly long and gets caught on everything, might not sound like a dealbreaker but believe me it is extremely annoying, would recommend use in an office or if you're not going to be moving very much at all. The eartips will begin to fall off of the actual earbud after a few wears, I bought the comply foam tips as a replacement and those stay on.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Li

customer_reviews.title: Source dependent
customer_reviews.text: Changed my mind. Yes they sound very good but one must have a source capable of driving them. On my fire tablet the sound quality was not impressive but off of my LG G2 which now is used only as a tablet, the sound is very, very good. Still would recommend the Betron products as their sound quality is not very different for a much cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: ANDRE L. DE GRAAF

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones. They sound good, and last long. In line controls work well and the buttons feel nice. I got after market ear tips due to losing some and now they fit better than ever. I'm basically in my own world when these are in at work. No need to have the music loud to drown out ambient noise too. These also work well for noise cancellation. I use them when I practice drums so that should tell you something.
customer_reviews.author: Chet Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, except the cable is super delicate - I'm returning mine.
customer_reviews.text: Fit great, look great, sound really good. There is a lot of mid bass, which I find can muddy up the sound. Also, cable micro-phonics are an issue, but solved by wearing the cord around the neck - the cable is long enough to accommodate this. FATAL FLAW: The area where the cord comes out of the jack is weak; it split and I can see the cord underneath after just a couple of weeks using the headphones. I'm not rough, and actually take care not to stress this bit given that most headphones suck in this area - the Momentums just happen to be extra weak. I will be returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Sparks Nevada

customer_reviews.title: previously I had CX300's as well as lower-cost betrons which I liked a fair bit
customer_reviews.text: Update: the cables have split, they’re a write-off. How sennheiser could design a product so poorly thought out is mind-blowing. I won’t buy sennheiser again. These were exactly what I was looking for. The sound quality is really decent; previously I had CX300's as well as lower-cost betrons which I liked a fair bit, but these are noticeably better than both. The earbuds themselves are fairly sizeable and can shift a bit over time, but it doesn't concern me - they stay in place fairly well even when running. The controls are great to have, part of the reason I upgraded.
customer_reviews.author: dj_nz

customer_reviews.title: Great iOS IEM's , maybe the best!
customer_reviews.text: I think for the price, these are a great IEM. I still think Fidue a83's are my compare all and top level benchmark of excellence... But the Fidue a83's don't have the IOS control/mic etc. I own a pair of xioami piston2 as well. Which are android based mic/controls yet amazing sound quality. I would consider these momentums to sound very similar to the the piston 2's yet more comfortable and iOS controls. Maybe a hint less texture in the bass and less tightness in the bass. Overall an excellent soundstage. But if you hear a83's the. Nothing compares to the 3D like sound stage and extremely textured bass and mids.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Connor

customer_reviews.title: I am so disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have always known Sennheiser to make great quality products. Which is why I was shocked to find my headphones falling apart after only 3 months. These are my main headphones, I ice them daily, but I always keep them put away in the case when I'm not using them. The wire casing has split at the end by the jack and now both earpieces keep coming apart where two pieces are joined together. I may have just gotten a really bad pair, but if this is the direction Sennheiser is going then I'll definitely be finding a new brand.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Grant

customer_reviews.title: Bad value for money. Poor quality of material.
customer_reviews.text: I researched this product and finally decided to purchase after reading all the positive reviews here. Even though it has good sound, the quality of material is really bad. After six months, plastic and wires just start falling apart like bad Halloween decoration. In one year I have gone through two of them. My first one started having problems after 6 months. The company was good enough to exchange the first one. I have been careful in using them but even then the next one lasted less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Raul

customer_reviews.title: SQ poorer than Apple current earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a gift for someone else, but ended up keeping them after we found they already had good headphones. I tried them yesterday, and was disappointed with the sound quality. With EQ off on my IPhone 6, playing music ripped myself of iTunes purchases, the bass seems heavy and bloated, the mid range recessed, and poor hf performance - more sizzle than extension. Nothing natural about the sound. The included Apple earbuds sound much better, but I can't stand the design as they never stay in my ears...will look at the IE60 or 80 or Grado's. Build quality seems nice, fit with standard buds is solid and they are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sweet
customer_reviews.text: Not as "noise cancelling" as the spendy ones. But, no one will hear your music flowing from your ears. I have wireless JBL that accents the bass more, but these are sweet.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: They also come with a very nice carrying case and several sizes of earbud covers
customer_reviews.text: My klipsch earbuds died this year and I decided to try sennheisers, which were suggested to me by a friend. They are spectacular! I am not a serious audiophile so they seemed a bit pricey but they are well worth the cost. The cord is substantial ( that was the problem with my klipsch) hopefully that will help with their durability. They also come with a very nice carrying case and several sizes of earbud covers. The sound is wonderfully crisp and clear with a perfect blend of bass and treble. I am really delighted with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Clarkson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound
customer_reviews.text: These are better than Beats By Dre in every category, very clear clean sound with perfect bass that's never overwhelming and sounds so clear and loud, I will be buying another pair as a backup
customer_reviews.author: Bryan C.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound. Weird malfunctions lately.
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound of these earbuds. But recently I noticed that the earbuds began making unwanted volume increases, pauses and skips while I’m playing music on my iPhone, Apple Music. I tested it on my MacBook to make sure that the source of these malfunctions is not the gender cable that hooks the earbuds to the phone. I hooked it directly to the audio hole on my MacBook and the same thing happens. I think that if I’m completely still and not touching the earbuds cable, it functions okay. But as soon as I start tapping my feet or moving, I get the pauses, volume increase and skips. It’s either the earbuds or the ghost.
customer_reviews.author: HANG S CHAY

customer_reviews.title: The Best Earbuds Under $100 you can find.
customer_reviews.text: I am a terminal audiophile, if the music doesn't sound like it should I am not a happy camper. I saw these Earbuds on sale and I knew Sennheiser made quality sound equipment so I ordered the momentum buds. These were IOS and I wanted a good set for my Apple Tablet and Sennheiser did not disappoint. Like my Bose ultra sounds these buds can handle a broad range of music, but these have more cord so I usually use these on my computer and the Bose in my bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Philllips

customer_reviews.title: Good until they fell apart
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds were great and I used them for about 2 years while working in an office. Around the two year mark the along the wire seems to have start degrading and peeling off. It now only loosely fits around the wire and has a soft/tacky texture. The sound from these things was absolutely great once broken in, but all in all I feel like they have a relatively short lifespan for wired earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: E. Gudding

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, not amazing, cheap materials.
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good sounding earbuds, as long as your expectation is for a pretty good sounding set of earbuds for use with a phone. They sound slightly veiled with slightly bloated bass, but overall they have a nice frequency response. Prospective buyers note: they look nice in pictures but the build quality is cheap as heck. All plastic, no weight cords like speaker wire. Due to the build quality I don't feel their worth the asking $, but I get they had to cut corners to achieve Sennheiser house sound signature at a low price point. Still cheapy.
customer_reviews.author: HifiJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, clarity confirmed.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy clarity at volume overall. These headphones deliver just that. They yield rich sound for their size. Seems to separate layers though, which is good or bad, depending on your tastes. I personally enjoy the distinction between each layer of music. I used these as a hands-free for my phone for GPS purposes, comfortable for the six hours I wore them. The only thing I didn't care for was the carrying case's insert for tangle free usage. I removed the insert, and just drop my headphones in the case with a light, two-knuckle wrap.
customer_reviews.author: W. Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Lacking quality
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart in just over 1 year of use. First taped the connector and now the ear piece wiring is giving up Casual commuter use on train and walk to work. No gym or activities with these. Also to really utilize them you need to buy the foam ear pieces. If you get them under 50 good buy otherwise not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Van der Computer

customer_reviews.title: Good choise, love it.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: In several months I've lost a headphone tip and tried to replace with extra tips provided but they all has a different size and the most convenient was the original one which was hard to find. I've contacted the support - no response at all. Half a year later, with headphones average usage due to jack 90 angle connection it wore out. It still works and I like the sound quality and inability to tangle them but durability is poor. OLD: I tried aJays and GGMM but Sennheiser is my choice now. The proper weight, good noise isolation, quality sound and no noise from your mic on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Alexey S.

customer_reviews.title: This might be the best sound quality of any headphones I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This might be the best sound quality of any headphones I've ever had. The first pair I bought were ruined when my 2 y/o son threw them into the garbage disposal, (probably because I was always wearing them), and the second pair were stolen. Even after all that I am still tempted to buy another, just because the sound quality and microphone for phone calls was so clear and overall excellent. Maybe later...
customer_reviews.author: Chimezirim Nwankwo

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones for a Small price
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I wanted a new headphones with a mic for my iPod Touch as I use the Facetime option with my girl but at the same time be able to use it on my Android phone too. The sound quality is excellent with deep bass and clear trebles. Plus the controls work brilliantly with my iPod although control is limited with the Android but then that's OS ecosystem issue not the headphones. The build quality is excellent and especially the deep red color with the two toned black. The metallic accents on the earphone head adds style to the whole thing. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Christopher David

customer_reviews.title: ... headphones for a few years now as they were recommended by a musician to me
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a pair Sennheiser headphones for a few years now as they were recommended by a musician to me. What I hear in the headphones in terms of volume adjustment and sound equalization between instruments is the same as what is heard on a stereo unit. These in–ear headphones keep up that tradition. The quality of sound is not the best you can buy, but for the price, they're worth the money. I listen to every kind of music for the most part, and it all sounds fine. The construction of the headphones is excellent – very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Paratopia

customer_reviews.title: Save your $ for some other earphones
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality product with poor wire quality and the cushions kept falling off until I lost all of them and being an irregular size cushions had to retire them before their normal useful life (like 1-2 years).
customer_reviews.author: Abdul Manaf

customer_reviews.title: Durable earbuds
customer_reviews.text: They are great and sturdy earbuds. Great for when I am working out and the sound is really good. The only bone I have to pick is that it isn't compatible with my iPod nano! The pause button works but the volume button doesn't work with the iPod nano so that was a bummer. I have an iPhone 5S and it works excellent with my phone just the iPod I was bummed and gave 4 stars about. Also it's cool that it has volume button , pause button and a mic. Aside from that it's great !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loving these!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound! As with all good headphones, they started out quiet and treble-heavy, but with regular use they're now nice and broken in, and produce a nice rounded sound, with good bass, and clear crisp mids and highs; they're also a lot louder now at lower settings. I listen mostly to electronic (house, techno) music, and these work flawlessly with it. They're comfortable, seat nicely in the ear and get a good seal. And the included case is awesome for tangle free storage. I'd buy these again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $100
customer_reviews.text: Run a few tests and unlike some other online reviews suggested, the lows are not reproduced well. The title also suggests that you get the Black-Red earbuds yet in fact they are simply black.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, bad build quality
customer_reviews.text: Wore these for a year, probably for 4 hours a day on average (I'm lucky enough to be able to wear headphones at work). What people say about the build quality is true... The cable is also super long and stuffing it all into your pants is annoying. The sound is great and they block out ambient noise really well. I'd look somewhere else if I were you.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Baron

customer_reviews.title: Bad build quality, sound is mediocre, stopped working after a month.
customer_reviews.text: Earbuds felt like cheap plastic. The left earbud stopped working after a month, and attempts to talk to support were more than frustrating (agent couldn't remember which model I was asking for assistance with) and overall has soured my opinion of the brand. Sound was very mediocre, but for the price it was almost insulting. Better sound from budget Sony earbuds. Hard pass.
customer_reviews.author: GoldenMonsterRD

customer_reviews.title: Great for listening, but not while working out.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality of these headphones is honestly amazing. I was wowed by the crisp sound and comfortable bass. The only downside is they fall out during jogging or working out all the time. They also emit this weird brief shock in my ears that will lower the sound with each one. These usually occur every 30 seconds. It is only while I'm running which could be from static build up, but I haven't had that with any of my other headphones. I would rate these 5/5 for casual listening, but only 3/5 for listening while working out.
customer_reviews.author: Aidan Logstrom

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend to anyone needing a new pair
customer_reviews.text: These fit my ears perfectly. Was a bit different at first putting them in. But now they go in so easy and they stay in. That's the key. They stay in. Great sound as well. I can hear really good base now and the individual strings being plucked on a guitar. Wow. I'd highly recommend these to anyone looking for a new pair. The volume up and down work great on my Samsung phone as well. The mic is an added bonus and it works great as well.
customer_reviews.author: david allen

customer_reviews.title: Decent sound quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Initially I didn't like these at all: booming bass, very weak higher range and lack of definition in sound. But these seem to require time to "break in": after nearly 12 hours of using them, the sound started to get better defined. The bass is still a bit too powerful to my liking, but the highs and the soundstage definitely improved! Will see how these sound in a few days...
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry Nikiforov

customer_reviews.title: Wish they had lasted longer for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these earbuds in 2017 and just this year the rubber started to split and expose the wires and the right bud completely went out. I used them just about every single day and was hoping at the price I paid, they would have lasted longer. I have always loved the quality of Sennheiser and have had HD600 since 2002 and they still perform just as well as when I got them. I have bought a different pair of Sennheiser earbuds and hopefuly they don't start falling apart so easily. I guess I am lucky they lasted 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie K.

customer_reviews.title: Left ear stopped working after a year.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for just over a year and the left side stopped working. While the headphone worked I loved them and recommended them to others. I also started to notice the left ear bud would shock the inside of my ear from time to time but I was never able to recreate the issue myself. Since I bought these off amazon from a non-Sennheiser dealer I cannot get the 2-year warranty. When buying a new pair I will look into other options next time.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling White

customer_reviews.title: Decent sound, Terrible Durability
customer_reviews.text: OK sound quality, but terrible durability. Only lasted for 2-3 months of use. The cord had kinked and the rubber tore exposing the wires. After about a month or two with use with exposed wires the ride side stopped working. Incredibly overpriced. Go for cheaper options, with comparable sound with better durability. Extremely disappointing for a high price point.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon N.

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement if you are tired of your cheap ear ...
customer_reviews.text: Great improvement if you are tired of your cheap ear buds or stock apple ear buds. Once you plug these into your computer and adjust your equalizer settings, these start sounding great. Although, on an Iphone they still sounds pretty good. I recommend buying some Comply T-150's or any foam ear tip for these. The stock tips can slide out of your ear after some time and you cannot beat the comfort of the foam tips.
customer_reviews.author: jmoore

customer_reviews.title: I've had them for about six months now and had no problems--they still sound as great as the day I bought them
customer_reviews.text: These have been surprisingly durable. I've had them for about six months now and had no problems--they still sound as great as the day I bought them, despite a lot of abuse. I'm not enough of an audiophile to give a detailed review, but the sound is a vast improvement over whatever $5 buds from Wal-Mart I was using before and the in-line controls are great.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Neal

customer_reviews.title: My favorite headphones ever without a doubt
customer_reviews.text: My favorite headphones ever without a doubt. Mostly listen to edm and these headphones are unreal, they bring so much drama to every note and it all screams at you in the perfect way. They sound amazing and fit so comfortable I can wear them for 8 hours straight and wear them while snowboarding as well. Sound insulstion is very good too considering they are just ear buds. The only part that bothers me is the tips keep falling off so it gets annoying when I have to buy tips and wait few days before I can use them.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy These
customer_reviews.text: They look nice, but they don’t work as advertised. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Grossnickle

customer_reviews.title: Buggy volume controls
customer_reviews.text: Sounds very good! Very detailed mids and highs, and extremely punch bass. The wire design could be a bit better as the part of the wire nearest to the headphone jack seems flimsy. Another major drawback is that the volume controls are a bit buggy on Apple devices. If I press volume up, it sticks, meaning the volume keeps increasing until max volume. This renders the volume controls essentially useless on my Mac. Didn't see this on my iPhone though.
customer_reviews.author: M.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Headphones as Casual Listener
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a headphones expert, so can't go into great details. The upgrade from headphones that come with your smartphone versus these are substantial. I can't explain it, but just a more premium sound. I can say that the build quality have been excellent, and while having a slightly unorthodox shape, fit into my ears well with the ear bud tips. The mic/volume rocker works perfectly with my Galaxy S6. I go to the gym with them, and haven't had any real issues with them slipping out. Only things that I would like to see would be a shirt clip, and a slightly shorter cable. For some reason it's very long.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Amazing in-ear headphones
customer_reviews.text: Amazing in-ear headphones! I actually first bought the Sennheiser Game Zero headphones because I wanted the microphone attachment... but those $160+ headphones honestly can't compare to the Sennheiser Momentum earbuds. The sound quality may not be as distinct, but these earbuds have a much better sound (in my opinion), and easily beat any other earbuds that I own. Unfortunately my pair was stolen when I left them in a classroom only 2 days after purchasing them... but even in that two day timeframe, I could easily tell that these earbuds are absolutely awesome. :) Buying them again with Christmas money but in the red version! Hopefully I won't lose them again. :(
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through a few pairs if lower end simple earbuds (panasonic, sony) and wanted to invest in something a little nicer, even though I was not particularly unhappy with the pairs I've had. These earbuds blew me away, however, and it's hard to go back! The fit is comfy, they aren't too heavy but feel well made, the volume/play switch works great, and the sound quality is unbelievable. I'd say they're worth the price so far!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Sound was good, but they'll short on you
customer_reviews.text: The wiring is fairly weak in these. The manufacturer warranty is for two years, and mine shorted close to where they plug in just past the two year mark. The sound quality for an in-ear bud is quite good. Replacing with a different brand with a stronger cable.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Lack luster bass and in-line remote sits too close to your face.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones look great in pictures but they have a huge design flaw. The in-line remote is so high up that you can't see it with the headphones in and it sits right next to your face. If you went out in public you'd look ridiculous. The clarity of audio is great but the bass is lack luster, which is a bummer for anyone who listens to EDM. Not really sure why these headphones got such fantastic reviews everywhere. Back to Amazon you go.
customer_reviews.author: Th3MadScientist

customer_reviews.title: I kinda liked them at first
customer_reviews.text: It is extremely overpriced, 100$ for this earbuds... I kinda liked them at first, but after 2 months of using it, my ears started to hart, I don't listen to high volume, it just produces certain frequencies of sound waves that harts my ears, nearly immediately I put them on! I don't have same problem with my ATH m40x. Worst purchase of the year.
customer_reviews.author: Merab

customer_reviews.title: The sound is great as far as my experience with sound is concerned
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great as far as my experience with sound is concerned. But I swear Sennheiser engineered these ear buds to be the perfect length, material and shape to CATCH ON EVERYTHING. It's the most infuriating thing when you can't leave the house without your pricey pair of headphones catching on three different door knobs or other objects. This is paired with an absolutely terrible lack of durability. The protective cover for the cord split two months after I got them from, I kid you not, being in my pocket. The sound is great but other than that, the build quality is total trash. Avoid these if you want something that lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Tomczyk

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding earbuds; I was quite surprised by the sound. Microphone also sounds great. Flat cable, nicely designed earbuds that hang out of the ear a little but not too much, good tips that sit in and close off your ear completely (both sizes), and comes with a hard carrying case for travel. Great purchase and I will buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Cynosure

customer_reviews.title: ... bought these as a gift for my mom - sturdy construction, great fit in ear
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift for my mom - sturdy construction, great fit in ear, microphone is amazing quality (makes it easier for me to speak to her on the phone!) and she raves about the sound quality. She listens to mostly trance and light house music. When I listened to them, they felt a little lacking in the lows but definitely crisp and clean highs.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound and great noise isolation
customer_reviews.text: sound and sound stage is quite impressive as is the noise isolation due to the ergonomic shape of buds, however these are not for bass heads as bass is not emphasized beyond a normal amount.
customer_reviews.author: Bill2199

customer_reviews.title: Good sound terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Great budget iems. They sound great. The build quality is so bad though that they are not worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dayto

customer_reviews.title: And the microphonics were horrible! I wear my IEMs while commuting so microphonics ...
customer_reviews.text: Overly heavy bass. Too fake for my taste. And the microphonics were horrible! I wear my IEMs while commuting so microphonics need to be low, and these made listening unpleasant. I actually reverted to my apple earbuds for a more pleasurable experience. :/ I had Hifiman RE400s prior. Going back to Hifimans.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good, not super comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds excellent but then I have always liked the Sennheiser sound. They are not as comfortable as I expected and I have used many brands of in ear headphones over the years. I still have to test the larger size tips though. Update: I went up one size in both ears and they are a bit more comfortable. Not as comfortable as other brands I own, but good enough for a couple of hours.
customer_reviews.author: SciFiOne

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Keep in truckin.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. Disappointed for the money. But they work well. Kinda uncomfortable though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too much static
customer_reviews.text: The sound is good in game, but there is so much static picked up in them. I had tried using them for gaming and they had extra noise coming from them. Turns out they pick up radio signals, I heard the football games going on through them (I play video games, not watch football in my free time). Very disappointed by this, they feel great and i only wish the feedback wasn’t there and that extra noise wasn’t a thing as well
customer_reviews.author: skye hayes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for on-the-go quality sound for my Android phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones to replace my Klipsch S4i headphones. The sound quality and fit are great. I have an LG G3 phone for which I am able to change the song and volume from the buttons on the cable. I did lose an ear tip in my pocket, and I was able to call Sennheiser and order a pack of replacement tips for about $10. These headphones are a big step up from a ~$50 pair.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Alcorn

customer_reviews.title: Cable quality is not good and doesnt last
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality on these is great like other Sennheiser headphones that I own. Although like others have said the cable quality is garbage. The rubber cable has split open on the base of the right angle headphone jack. They are also wearing by the earphone itself where the wire is threaded through. These headphones would be a lot better if the cable was alot tougher. They still work but I have to be a lot more careful with them now.
customer_reviews.author: Jml403

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser Momentum in Ear Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have great sound and the controls work like expected. They are the 5th Sennheiser headphones I've purchased. I like these very much and would have given them a 5 star rating except for one issue. The rubber pads will not stay on. Almost every time I remove them from my ears at least one of the pads will stay in my ear. I nearly lost one the other day, which in my mind is a very large issue since once the pad is gone the headphones are no longer usable. So they should get a 3 star rating but due to being a great product overall I give them a 4 star.
customer_reviews.author: LeeC

customer_reviews.title: Good quality; way, way too long! Gets caught everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Doesn't fall out of my ears even when I'm biking and a little sweaty. The headphones are excessively long. I am lucky if this only gets caught on something twice a day: my bag, someone's bag on the metro, or random things walking around. The cord is six feet long!!! Four would have been sufficient, three would have been perfect!
customer_reviews.author: José Woss

customer_reviews.title: Daddy of the year gift.
customer_reviews.text: This was a daddy purchase and my daughter absolutely loves the sound quality and features.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl A. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time; moreover, what's most important is that these sounds just great in this price range. One additional thing that i noticed is that, for a month of listening music while walking (big fan of walking sessions - especially during the weekends i can easily make 20 miles round trips) those headphones never felt out of my ears by them selves which is a big plus for me while being active and not having an issue with fitting them back into my ears :).
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser earbuds
customer_reviews.text: These sound amazing, no comparison to other earbuds, well worth the price. I personally wish it had a *mute* button instead of a "hang up the phone" button as I use these for phone calls. I recommend upgrading to the comply foam instead of the soft silicone that comes with these... much more comfortable plus it seals out all outside noise.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Not the same product as the ones i used before
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be either a fake or an inferior product to the actual product as i have been ordering and using 4 of the same one from diff buyers or direct from the manufacturer over the years. The sound quality is more like a $40 product
customer_reviews.author: Ducati

customer_reviews.title: Best In-Ear Headphones under $100
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are fantastic in every aspect. From the highs to the lows, everything is balanced. The highs are crisp and the lows are deep and punchy while neither of the 2 overpower each other or the mids. I bought these when they were around $75 I think and they are hands down my favorite pair of headphones. I'm no audiophile but I like some quality sound and they're at a great price. They have a nice looking design and the in line remote works perfect with my phone (Galaxy Note 5). Overall these are one of the best pairs of in ear headphones you can buy under $100
customer_reviews.author: Darla Burgoyne

customer_reviews.title: Don't like them!
customer_reviews.text: I must I ordered these by mistake after reading rave reviews about another brand. So I was surprised, the first time I used them, that there's an added background noise which sounds like I'm underwater, that they are uncomfortable, and they fall out when I move my head. If I had read the reviews associated with this product, I would, correctly, have purchased a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha G

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive sound, decent build quality.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is abnormally good for this price. I prefer them over many of my more expensive pairs. The bass is especially noteworthy, a lot of power but certainly not muddy or over-done like some competitors (beats by dr. dre, etc.). The only down side is the build quality. I am already noticing weak points where the wire is ripping after about 9 months of use. Very good chance these will not survive more than 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First Rate German Headphones
customer_reviews.text: The detail and bass are first rate. I am a little embarrassed that they sound as good, on an Ipod( or a little better) than my bigger and costlier Beyerdynamic 990s on their Schiit amp. I have worked out with them and pull-out didn't occur at all. I keep hearing small details not heard before. Really outstanding sound and value. The other reviewer was right, the packaging is first class, and the carry case will hold the headphones and an Ipod mini after removing the insert
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Harlan

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as Sony Extra Bass
customer_reviews.text: Sony extra bass are louder - more Bass - sound better and cheaper...
customer_reviews.author: Markuz Delaghetto

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, uncomfortable fit.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound but uncomfortable fit. The optional foam tips I got for this made an improvement on the fit inside the ear. However, they still stick out away from my ears to the point where it's difficult to wear a motorcycle helmet. I still prefer my Shure E215's for feel inside the ear and their compact design but they don't beat these Sennheisers on sound.
customer_reviews.author: Matt N.

customer_reviews.title: They sound awesome, look good despite being part plastic and have ...
customer_reviews.text: They sound awesome, look good despite being part plastic and have overall been a good experience. They come in very premium feeling carrying case and extra tips. My replacement tips have all been very prone to falling off though so as long as you're careful and store them in the provided carrying case you should be fine. With earbuds as expensive as this you shouldn't just be shoving them in your pocket anyway.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser knocked it out of the park on this one.
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through a ton of headphones over the years and I've tried everything from lolBeats to Bose, so I'm not being biased when I say Sennheiser has easily put out the best in-ear headphones I've ever heard. The layers of music are clear and rich. You don't feel like you're missing anything and the levels aren't off. They do a great job of not falling out and Sennheiser even sends you many different sizes of rubber covers so you find your perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Umar Farooq

customer_reviews.title: I'm a big fan of seinnheiser and have used many ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of seinnheiser and have used many of their products. These headphones focus too much on bass response losing performance in mids and highs. The Panasonic ergo fit for less than $10 provide a more balanced listening experience.

customer_reviews.title: Best earbuds ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: Alright so. I've read the reviews and was iffy about the bass. I listen to a lot of hip hop and metal etc. I was so pleasantly surprised. The bass is very clear and hits hard (for the normal person that enjoys good quality). Quality of the cases and everything that comes with it is on point too. Honestly can't hear sh*t besides my music. It's so nice and blocked out. I love the earbuds. Cord looks very stable but the headphones are still under a 2 year warranty which was important to me. Overall these earbuds are just about the greatest accessory I've ever bought especially since they work with my ps4.
customer_reviews.author: Dominik Arifaj

customer_reviews.title: These are very nice ear phones
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice ear phones. You are given a few ear tips to choose from. Cord is nice and long. The shape of it also helps keep it from getting tangled. Very rarely do I have to fight with these taking them out of the case to unravel them. Mids highs and lows in my opinion are great. My only gripe with these is that they aren't loud enough. They max out at what senn probably considers a "safe" level. Other than that I've been using them for a year along with other pairs and I still go back to these often.
customer_reviews.author: A. J.

customer_reviews.title: These are the best ear buds I have used
customer_reviews.text: These are the best ear buds I have used. I get compliments from people on the phone because of the clarity of sound it transmits when using the phone. The music played through these is completely clear. Easy to use, and stylish. I also like the 90 degree plug.
customer_reviews.author: David Harchenko

customer_reviews.title: A great all around headphone!
customer_reviews.text: Just about all I can ask for in an in ear headphone. First the comfort, they do stick out a bit, but I can't hardly tell they are in, they are that good. Secondly, the have a nice sporty appearance, but not over the top. Finally, the sound, the sound great with a wide range of music. They a have very good lower bass, not enough to wash out the mids, the mids are still solid, but probably the weekest part of them. The highs are bright and clear without being harsh. Highly Recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric D. Myers

customer_reviews.title: As expected, works great and sounds pretty good. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly even after continuous use for the past 3-5 months. Remote control works perfectly for the Samsung Galaxy Note 5 and it suits my musical tastes, as it does not distort so far (Listened to oldies, pop, house, techno and indie music). Comes with a somewhat protective case and inside the case, there is a sturdy compartment to store your earphones plus the spare earbuds. I seldom rate things 5 stars but this is the first time I was able to use an earphone with lots of usage but nothing has broken so far and sounds still great.
customer_reviews.author: Lim Y.

customer_reviews.title: Insulation fails on the cables...Won't last more than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the reviews, and like the sound and function. But the material used to cover the cabling ("tangle resistant") degrades quickly, possibly due to absorbing oils from handling. It starts around the plug as the cord stretches and then splits there, but eventually will fail all over. I returned them around 6 months in, received refurbed with a limited shorter warranty and no more replacement. So they failed again same way and I never got to the promised 2 year warranty. A bit of a rip-off from a well regarded brand. No more for me.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Audio Profile is too bright for me.
customer_reviews.text: These sound pretty good and balanced. As others have mentioned the audio profile is a bit bright and the highs are particularly noticeable. My wife loves them but for me I prefer a flatter sound profile.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: I think these sound great, but they don't sound great for me
customer_reviews.text: Soooooo, I think these sound great, but they don't sound great for me. There's a dip in the mids on these earphones that may or may not sound pleasant to your ears. The ended up feeling kind of "empty" to my ears. I love the Momentum line, but I just found that these earbuds were not for me. They're still worth a try though as that may not be something you notice.
customer_reviews.author: O. Mcclelland

customer_reviews.title: Great bass, drowns out mids badly
customer_reviews.text: Bass is massively overblown and hurts highs and mids. Tried with multiple audio sources and genres of music and while they're great at bassy songs without distortion, they're mediocre every where else. Highs and mids really feel like they're being drowned out by a preference for lows. The lows are really nice though.
customer_reviews.author: Grizwald Yue

product_meta.title: Sennheiser Momentum In Ear (iOS version) - Black Red
product_meta.description: Color:Black Red| Operating System:iOS versionJoining Sennheiser's Style Selection series, MOMENTUM In-Ear brings together elegant appearance and high-performance sound. Created for individuals who follow their own path, MOMENTUM In-Ear celebrates mobility, freedom, ambition and excellence. Available in high-gloss black with red accents and mirror chrome detailing, these new earphones capture the style and sound of Sennheiser's acclaimed MOMENTUM headphones in a compact in-ear design - powerful bass, detailed vocal projection and great sound stage. Ear adapters in a range of sizes combined with a new slim stainless steel enclosure ensure a perfect fit for excellent attenuation of external noise. A newly designed oval cable geometry imparts a solid feel of quality while contributing to superior sound quality. Momentum In-Ear will be available in Apple iOS and Samsung Galaxy versions featuring convenient three-button in-line remotes with integrated mic for controlling music and taking calls. A premium carry case is included, finished with the same attention to detail and styling as the earphones. MOMENTUM In-Ear delivers an incredible listening experience in the smallest, most compact form.
feature_bullets: Apple iOS model using newly designed, tangle-free oval cable featuring 3-button in-line remote with integrated microphone. Connectivity Technology: Wired
Custom machined, low resonance stainless steel housing deliver a detailed and accurate sound
High-quality dynamic transducers produce high output level with low distortion
In ear canal design provides excellent attenuation of ambient noise. Multiple sized ear tips included insuring a personalized fit
Two year warranty when purchased from an authorized Sennheiser dealer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars1,560 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
